newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait to collect $330 mln owed by pro-Iraq Arabs.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait to collect $330 mln owed by pro-Iraq Arabs.

text.p: Kuwait will soon move to collect 100 million dinars ($330 million) owed by some Arab states which supported Iraq during the 1990-91 Gulf crisis, a senior banking official was quoted on Sunday as saying.
Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development General Manager Badr al-Humaidi "said that arrears owed by opponent states (Iraq supporters) would be collected soon," al-Rai al-Aam daily reported.
The Fund "did not carry out any contacts since (the 1991) liberation with these countries -- Jordan, Yemen, Sudan and Mauritania," he said in an interview.
Kuwait downgraded ties and cut generous economic aid to several states it accused of supporting former occupier Iraq during the Gulf crisis.

In recent weeks Kuwait has said it would improve ties with some of these countries and a few steps were taken despite criticism by parliamentarians. Diplomats say the moves also lack popular support from many ordinary Kuwaitis.

Oil-rich Kuwait originally created the Fund to offer fellow Arab states soft loans and technical assistance grants for public works projects and has extended operations to include a host of developing countries. obtaining loans from the Fund.
